entry.title: Building Google Assistant Apps with Python
Intro to GraphQL with Python
entry.summary:
Description

GraphQL is a new way to build APIs that are more flexible on the frontend and require less development time on the backend. This talk will introduce to you how and why you should use GraphQL and how to implement GraphQL with Python.

entry.title: Python Applications with Google Drive SDK
entry.summary:
Description

An overview of the Google Drive SDK and how to write Python applications that integrate the SDK.

entry.title: A Guide to Bad Programming
entry.summary:
Description

In a sea of talks and information about how to improve your coding skills, this talk will make a case for bad code in your everyday life. In this talk you'll learn how and why you should write bad code. â€‹ Abstract Inspired by "the queen of sh*tty robots" and a talk I had recently with a friend about how often our code "optimizations" and best practices don't matter, this talk will point out some of the obsessions we have as professional programmers that don't matter and can even be harmful to the progress of a product. The talk will show how identifying as a "bad programmer" can improve your skills in the long run and help you become a better programmer. Lastly, the talk will showcase some "bad practices" that can be fine or even good when used appropriately.

https://speakerdeck.com/pybay2016/paul-bailey-a-guide-to-bad-programming

entry.title: An Introduction to AngularJS for the Python Web Developer
entry.summary:
Description

An introduction to AngularJS and how to use it in your Python web app. This talk will cover different web architectures and how Python and AngularJS fit together to implement them. It will also cover the frontend concepts introduced by the AngularJS and how to use them.

entry.title: End the Holy Wars of Formatting
entry.summary:
Description

Many Python developers came to the language because of its elegance and styling. However, we all have a different sense of style and often waste time in code reviews arguing over different ways to format our code. This talk will introduce you to a new tool called YAPF which takes a slightly different approach than other tools like autopep8 and pep8ify. We'll talk about what is different about YAPF and why its approach is better suited to make us more happy and efficient developers. The talk will also showcase some examples of YAPF in everyday use.

entry.title: Python 101.0 - Learn Programming with Python! (Part 1)
entry.summary:
Description

This hands-on coding workshop is for people completely new to programming. Bring your laptop, running Windows, Mac OS, or Linux.

We'll be using Koding.com for all examples and assignments. You can sign up for a free account before the class to get a head start.

Class Requirments

  • Computer with a web browser
  • Free Koding.com account

entry.title: Python 101.0 - Learn Programming with Python! (Part 2)
entry.summary:
Description

1pm - 4pm Continuation of morning Intro to Python hands on coding workshop.
